titleStmt.title: Bounce, and Fopp,
An Epistle from a dog at Twickenham

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: To Thee Sweet Fop these lines J Send
Who tho' no Spaniel am a Freind.
My Tail indeed twas but in play
Now flurting this, & now that way
Did with a touch of just the tip
Once chance to hurt Your Lap dog Ship
But thence to think J'le bite Your Head of
Sure Bounce is One you never read of.Fop You can dance & make a leg
Can fetch and carry cringe & beg,
And what's the top of all Your tricks
Can Stoop to pick up Strings & Sticks
Wee Country Dogs Love Nobler Sport,
And Scorn the pranks of Dogs at Court
Fye naughty thing where'ere you come
To fart & piss about the room
To lay your Head in every lap
And when They think not of you Snap
The worst that Envy, or that Spite
Can Say of me is, J can bite.
That Sturdy Beggars, Rogues in raggs,
That poke at Me, can make no braggs
And that to towze Such things as flutter
To Honest Bounce is Bread and Butter
While you & every Courtly Fop,
Fawn on The Devil for a chop,
J've the Humanity to hate
A Butcher, tho' He brings Me meat,
And let me tell you have a Nose
(What ever Stinking Fopps Suppose)
That under Cloath of Gold, or Tissue,
Can Smell a plaister or an issue.Your pilfering Lord with Simple Pride
May wear a picklock at His Side,
My Master wants no key of State
For Bounce can keep His House and GateBefore my Puppyes Set your beef
Not one True Bounce will be a Theif
Nor one without permission feed
(Though come of Jlays hungry Breed)
But what Soe're the Fathers Race,
From me They Suck a little Grace,
While your Fine Whelps learn All to Steal
Bred up by hand, and chick and veal.See Bounce like Berecynthia crown'd
With thundring Jnfants All around.
Beneath beside Her and atop
A hundred Sons & not One Fop
When All Such Dogs have had Their Dayes,
As Knavish Pams, & fawning Trayes,
The Motley Race of Hervey queenies
And Courtly Vices, Beastly Venyes,
Fair Thames Shall hear from Shoar to Shoar,
A hundred Bounces manly roar,My Eldest born resides not far
Where Shines Great Straffords guilded Starr,
To those high doors with equall grace
He Stands The Guardian of the Place
My Second Child of Fortune waits,
At Burlingtons Palladian Gates.
Jn whose Bright Palace every Guest,
And every Dog's Supremely blest.And oh would Fate the Bliss decree
To Mine (J ask it not to Me).
That Two My Tallest Sons might grace
Each walking with Majestick Pace
JÃ¼lus Side as erst Evanders,
Jnstead of Spyes, & Pimps, & Panders,
That So a Noble youth and True,
Might have at least a Freind, or Two;
Then Bounce (tis all that Bounce can crave)
Shall wagg Her Tail within the GraveAnd tho' no Doctors Whigg or Tory Ones
Except The Sect of Pythagoreans
Have Jmmortality assign'd
So any Beast but Drydens Hind,
Yet Master P- Whom Witt and Sence
Have made Tremendous as a Prince,
Tho' now of Mighty Peers He Sings,
And now a word or two of Kings
Has Sworn by Stix (The Poets Oath,
The dread of Dogs & Poets both)
His Lords and Ladyes He'le renounce
To Sing Fidelity, and Bounce.R556349P
